cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles E of Andros Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest along the Bahamas, forecast to turn NNW then north hugging/just offshore the southeast U.S. coastline and tracking toward the South Carolina–North Carolina coast before accelerating up the mid-Atlantic seaboard
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina / southeastern North Carolina coast (around Myrtle Beach–Wilmington)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watch yet issued north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Boca Raton FL to Volusia/Flagler County Line FL; Tropical-storm warnings confined to south-central FL at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds have a 24% cumulative chance (34-kt) and a small 4% chance of reaching 50-kt; gusty conditions likely Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks close to the Cape Fear coast, 2–4 ft of inundation above ground is possible Tuesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 2–4 in. with isolated 6 in. bands over coastal North Carolina, leading to flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible brief tornadoes in outer rain bands.
